alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Marion; Meigs; Sequatchie (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 09 at 11:03PM CST until December 10 at 2:00AM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM EST /215 AM CST/ EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Hamilton, Marion, Meigs and Sequatchie. * WHEN...Until 315 AM EST /215 AM CST/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1203 AM EST /1103 PM CST/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chattanooga, Jasper, Soddy-Daisy, Signal Mountain, South Pittsburg, Walden, Lakesite, Kimball, Fairmount, Red Bank, Powells Crossroads, Falling Water, Lone Oak, North Chickamauga Creek Gorge, Middle Valley, Mowbray Mountain, Flat Top Mountain, Hicks Gap State Park, Shady Grove and Haletown (guild). - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
